column1: 3.9.5.3	  Summary of evidence and recommendations for the diagnosis and treatment of urosepsis

A Gram stain of urethral discharge or a urethral smear that shows > 5 leukocytes per high power field   (Ã— 1,000) and gonococci located intracellularly as Gram-negative diplococci, indicates gonococcal   urethritis.
Validated NAATs of first-void urine samples have better sensitivity and specificity than any of the other   tests available for the diagnosis of chlamydial and gonococcal infections.
